+[float]
+==== Removing persistent cluster settings
+
+There may be situations where a node contains incompatible persistent cluster
+settings that prevent the cluster from forming. The `elasticsearch-node
+remove-settings` tool allows you to forcefully remove those persistent
+settings from the on-disk cluster state. The tool takes a list of settings
+as parameters that should be removed, and also supports wildcard patterns.
+
+The intended use is:
+
+* Stop the node
+* Run `elasticsearch-node remove-settings name-of-setting-to-remove` on the node
+* Repeat for all other master-eligible nodes
+* Start the nodes
